feasts: Departure of St. Peter Elrahawy, Bishop of Gaza
Consecration of St. Abba Shenouda's Church
1 Kiahk.summary: St. Peter Elrahawy, born 409 A.D. in Edessa, served as Bishop of Gaza. He practiced asceticism, relocated St. James' body, and confirmed believers in Palestine. He died after a divine vision. Also, commemoration of St. Shenouda’s church consecration.

feasts: Departure of St. Abba Hor, the Monk
2 Kiahk.summary: St. Abba Hor, from Abraht, lived as a monk in the desert. In Alexandria, he miraculously revived a child, then returned to the desert, dying peacefully after a life of asceticism.

feasts: Entrance of St. Mary into the Temple
3 Kiahk.summary: At age three, St. Mary, dedicated to God by her mother Anna, entered the Jerusalem Temple. She lived there for 12 years, later chosen by Joseph as her guardian.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Andrew the Apostle
4 Kiahk.summary: St. Andrew, brother of St. Peter, preached in Lydd and Kurdistan. Despite converting many, he was tortured, crucified, and stoned in Azrinos, dying as a martyr.

feasts: Departure of Prophet Nahum
Martyrdom of St. Victor
Martyrdom of St. Isidore
5 Kiahk.summary: Prophet Nahum, from Galilee, foretold Nineveh’s destruction. St. Victor, from Assiut, was martyred in boiling water for refusing idolatry. St. Isidore’s martyrdom is also commemorated.

feasts: Departure of St. Abraam, 62nd Pope
Martyrdom of St. Anatolius
6 Kiahk.summary: St. Abraam, a merchant turned patriarch, distributed wealth to the poor and abolished corrupt customs. He performed a miracle moving Mukatam Mountain. St. Anatolius’ martyrdom is commemorated.

feasts: Departure of St. Matthew the Poor
7 Kiahk.summary: St. Matthew, abbot in Aswan, healed the sick and cast out spirits. He lived ascetically, befriending beasts, and died peacefully.

feasts: Departure of St. Heraclas, 13th Pope
Martyrdom of Sts. Barbara and Juliana
Martyrdom of Sts. Esi and Thecla
Departure of St. Samuel, Abbot
8 Kiahk.summary: St. Heraclas, 13th Pope, converted pagans. Sts. Barbara and Juliana were martyred for their faith. Sts. Esi and Thecla endured torture. St. Samuel, abbot, defended Orthodoxy.

feasts: Departure of St. Poemin, the Confessor
9 Kiahk.summary: St. Poemin, from Bani-Khaseeb, became a monk and endured torture for his faith. He healed the Empress of Rome and died peacefully.

feasts: Relocation of St. Severus’ Body
Departure of St. Nicholas, Bishop of Myra
10 Kiahk.summary: St. Severus’ body was miraculously relocated to Zogag Monastery. St. Nicholas, Bishop of Myra, performed charitable acts and endured persecution, dying after the Council of Nicea.

feasts: Departure of St. Abba Pijimi
11 Kiahk.summary: St. Pijimi, from Feesha, became a monk in Scetis. He lived ascetically, converted Euphrates’ people, and died after 70 years of worship.

feasts: Commemoration of Archangel Michael
Departure of St. Hedra, Bishop of Aswan
Commemoration of St. John the Confessor
Council Against Benates
12 Kiahk.summary: Archangel Michael is commemorated. St. Hedra, Bishop of Aswan, became a monk and died peacefully. St. John the Confessor and a council against Benates are noted.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Ammonius, Bishop of Esna
Martyrdom of Many Christians in Esna
13 Kiahk.summary: St. Ammonius, Bishop of Esna, and many Christians were martyred by Arianus for refusing idolatry. Their bodies were preserved miraculously.

feasts: Martyrdom of Sts. Behnam, Sarah, and Their 40 Companions
14 Kiahk.summary: Sts. Behnam and Sarah, with 40 companions, were martyred in Persia for their Christian faith after miracles confirmed their belief.

feasts: Departure of St. Gregory, Patriarch of Armenia
15 Kiahk.summary: St. Gregory, Armenian Patriarch, survived 15 years in a pit, converted King Tiridates, and restored the Armenian Church before dying peacefully.

feasts: Departure of Gideon, Judge of Israel
Martyrdom of Sts. Harouadi, Ananias, Khouzi
Consecration of St. James’ Church
16 Kiahk.summary: Gideon, a Judge of Israel, defeated Midianites with 300 men. Sts. Harouadi, Ananias, and Khouzi were martyred. St. James’ church was consecrated.

feasts: Departure of St. Luke the Stylite
17 Kiahk.summary: St. Luke, a Persian centurion turned monk, lived on a pillar for 45 years, performed miracles, and died with his relics relocated to Constantinople.

feasts: Relocation of St. Titus’ Relics
Commemoration of Sts. Heracleas and Philemon
18 Kiahk.summary: St. Titus’ relics were moved to Constantinople, where miracles occurred. Sts. Heracleas and Philemon, a martyr and priest, are commemorated.

feasts: Departure of St. John, Bishop of El-Borollos
19 Kiahk.summary: St. John, Bishop of El-Borollos, built a hostel, became a monk, and eradicated heresies. He died after visions of Sts. Antony and Macarius.

feasts: Departure of Haggai the Prophet
20 Kiahk.summary: Haggai, a Levite prophet, urged the rebuilding of Solomon’s temple after the Babylonian exile. He died in Jerusalem 430 years before Christ.

feasts: Commemoration of Virgin Mary
Martyrdom of St. Barnabas
21 Kiahk.summary: The Virgin Mary, Theotokos, is commemorated. St. Barnabas, a Levite apostle, preached with St. Paul, was martyred in Cyprus.

feasts: Commemoration of Archangel Gabriel
Departure of St. Anastasius, 36th Pope
22 Kiahk.summary: Archangel Gabriel, announcer of Christ’s birth, is commemorated. St. Anastasius, 36th Pope, restored churches and died after writing 12 books.

feasts: Departure of David, Prophet and King
Departure of St. Timothy, Anchorite
23 Kiahk.summary: King David, a prophet from Judah, defeated Goliath and ruled justly. St. Timothy, an anchorite, lived ascetically for 30 years.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Ignatius, Patriarch of Antioch
Departure of St. Philogonus, Patriarch of Antioch
Birth of St. Takla Haymanot
24 Kiahk.summary: St. Ignatius, a disciple of St. John, was devoured by beasts. St. Philogonus, an ascetic patriarch, died peacefully. St. Takla Haymanot’s birth is commemorated.

feasts: Departure of St. John Kama
25 Kiahk.summary: St. John Kama and his wife lived as virgins. He became a monk in Scetis, founded a monastery, and died after visions of Sts. Athanasius and Mary.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Anastasia
Commemoration of St. Juliana
26 Kiahk.summary: St. Anastasia, born in Rome, ministered to prisoners and was martyred by fire. St. Juliana’s martyrdom is commemorated.

feasts: Martyrdom of St. Bisadi, Bishop
27 Kiahk.summary: St. Bisadi, Bishop of Ebsay, was tortured and beheaded for refusing idolatry, receiving the crown of martyrdom.

feasts: Martyrdom of 150 Men and 24 Women from Ansena
28 Kiahk.summary: 150 men and 24 women from Ansena, inspired by St. Paul’s miracle, confessed Christ and were beheaded, receiving martyrdom.

feasts: Feast of the Nativity (Christmas)
29 Kiahk.summary: Celebration of Jesus Christ’s birth in Bethlehem to the Virgin Mary, fulfilling prophecies. Shepherds witnessed angels announcing the Savior’s birth.

feasts: Departure of St. John, Archpriest of Scetis
30 Kiahk.summary: St. John, archpriest of Scetis, mentored saints and discerned sinners during Communion. He endured captivity and died at 90, leaving healing relics.
